channel.title: Enabling Secure Boot :: Zymbit Workshop
channel.description: Setting up secure booting Before we can set up the partitions, we need to make sure that we have the keys to decrypt the boot image that we created in the previous step. Those keys are stored on the USB Drive, so copy the public key to the local directory: sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt cp /mnt/z-image-1_pub_key.pem . Now that we have th key close at hand, itâ€™s time to have Bootware create the secure partitions for us.
